text: I am Teodula Pusma Carrion,
I live in the village of Ñangali.
I had a little child who was malnourished,
they used to give us food,
I went to get the food
then the nurses,
the nurses from Ñangali's medical centre,
said to me:
'Ok, we will give you but only if you get ligated,
if you don't we won't give you food
because you have too many children,
like rabbits,
and don’t want to get ligated.
I went to Huancabamba
And when I got to the hospital I was the last one.
I was a bit late
On one side there was a man who was getting a vasectomy,
he was from Huambanaca.
And when I got there
the man was already naked
then they said: 'Come in ma'am. Are you getting the ligation?'
'Yes'.
So they took off my clothes
and I was embarrassed with the man, cause he was naked
and I didn’t want it anymore.
So they said: 'Hurry ma'am, hurry!'
They put me in a bed
and then 4 people held me down.
2 grabbed my arms and 2 under my feet to put the injection
and then I don’t remember anymore.
